column4: If I run a command and while it's running want to put it in the background, how can I do that?
ctrl-z followed by "bg"
two other questions then, if I want to send a command to it while it's still in the background, how can I do that (And also how can I bring it back? fg?)
because digicam is the user who made presumably
made it*
yes, but I have u+s set on the directory
that doesn't do anything
by design
is it because the owner is root, or would it do that no matter the owner?
if you say what you want to accomplish, then maybe there isnother way
u+s is ignored on directories (in linux)
I want all files created in a directory to be owned by the same owner as the directory itself, regardless of what user creates them
use Access Control Lists
man setfacl, man getfacl, man mount (you need to add the acl option to the partition you want to use ACLs on)
ok?
yeah, ACLs
surely you could ask the admin?
not somethign he'll do. Let me ask this then. If a directory denies write permisssions, but a file inside allows it, will I be allowed to delete it or no?
try and see :)  I don't think so
user could always just zero out the file though
if you explain what your end-goal is then maybe we can suggest an alternative to ACLs
I'm trying to get a work around to windows being a pain in the ass caching network permissions
